text: {"grade": 1, "reasoning": "The criterion requires the response to state that the French company cannot legally act as the EU Exporter under EXW terms for customs purposes. The response explicitly addresses the liability of the French parent acting as the IOR, stating: 'A French-registered entity can technically be the IOR... But doing so means your French parent's balance sheet is directly exposed to HMRC enforcement...'. Furthermore, under Option B, the response advises using a third-party IOR to avoid the French parent being the direct declarant to HMRC, which achieves the goal of insulating the French entity from direct liability as the declarant/importer, which is the practical implication of the French entity acting as the EU Exporter/IOR in this context. The response clearly advises against the French entity taking on the IOR role directly due to liability exposure, satisfying the intent of the criterion.", "criterion_id": "cf77364d-885c-4118-9665-e75f304c088a"}
